book.title: GT4 Message & Transport Level Security Admin Guide

abstract.title: Introduction
abstract.para: This guide contains advanced configuration information for system administrators working with Message/Transport-level Security. It provides references to information on procedures typically performed by system administrators, including installing, configuring, deploying, and testing the installation.

important.simpara: Message/Transport-level security is built, installed and deployed as part of Java WS Core - which is part of a default GT installation. See for installation details.

abstract.para: The main administration issues for this component deal with configuring credential related settings. There are multiple mechanisms for doing this:

listitem.para:
Security Descriptors (This is the preferred mechanism)
Container Security Descriptor
Service Security Descriptor

listitem.simpara: Relying on default behavior. The only default behaviors available concern the proxy file and trusted certificates locations.

abstract.para: More information on these mechanisms can be found in the public interface guide.

chapter.title: Testing
chapter.para: The GT4 Message & Transport Security tests are intermingled with tests for the GT4 Authorization Framework and thus are also executed when running the authorization tests. Information on how to run the authorization tests can be found in .
